title: AdGuard Home
description: Free and open source, powerful network-wide ads & trackers blocking DNS server
name: adguard

title: Bitwarden
description: Unofficial Bitwarden compatible server written in Rust - Free and open source password management solution for individuals, teams, and business organizations
name: bitwarden

title: Home Assistant metrics
description: Used to show data from a Home Assistant installation
name: hametrics

env.name: GF_USERS_ALLOW_SIGN_UP
env.label: Allow sign up
env.description: Allow users to sign up. Defaults to false. The admin user can still create users from the Grafana Admin Pages.

title: Ivideon Server
description: A cloud-based video surveillance solution for business and the home
name: ivideon-server
note: Choose bridge network to access Ivideon Cloud and to be container accessible from the outside for the Ivideon Client local view.

env.name: EMAIL
env.label: Email
env.description: Your ivideon.com account

env.name: SERVER_NAME
env.label: Server name
env.description: Ivideon server name without spaces (displayed in Ivideon Client and Web UI)

title: Plex Media Server
description: Client-server media player system and software suite comprising two main components
name: plex

env.name: PUID
env.label: UID
env.description: Specifies the UID for the container internal plex user (used for process and file ownership)

env.name: PGID
env.label: GID
env.description: Specifies the GID for the container internal plex group (used for file ownership)

env.name: VERSION
env.label: Version
env.description: Let Docker handle the Plex Version

env.name: APP_BRANCH
env.label: APP_BRANCH
env.description: Set Branch to Development Branch (Latest code)

env.name: PUID
env.label: UID
env.description: Specifies the UID for the container internal transmission user (used for process and file ownership)

env.name: PGID
env.label: GID
env.description: Specifies the GID for the container internal transmission group (used for file ownership)

env.name: USER
env.label: USER
env.description: [Optional] Specifies same as rpc-username (used for script-torrent-done)

env.name: PASS
env.label: PASS
env.description: [Optional] Specifies same as rpc-password (used for script-torrent-done)

env.name: TZ
env.label: Timezone
env.description: e.g. Europe/Moscow

title: UniFi Controller
name: unifi
note: Choose right network (macvlan preferred). This container must be exposed to the outside. Bridge network does not work properly.

env.name: PUID
env.label: UID
env.description: Specifies the UID for the container internal unifi user (used for process and file ownership)

env.name: PGID
env.label: GID
env.description: Specifies the GID for the container internal unifi group (used for file ownership)

env.name: TZ
env.label: Timezone
env.description: e.g. Europe/Moscow

env.name: RUN_CHOWN
env.label: RUN_CHOWN
env.description: Set to false to disable the container automatic chown at startup. Speeds up startup process on overlay2 Docker hosts. It's critical that you insure directory/data permissions on all mapped volumes are correct before disabling this or UniFi and/or Mongo will not start.

title: Zabbix Agent
name: zabbix-agent
note: Choose right network (bridge preferred). This container port must be exposed for server to connect to it.

env.name: ZBX_HOSTNAME
env.label: Zabbix Agent hostname
env.description: ZBX_HOSTNAME - This variable is unique, case sensitive hostname.

env.name: ZBX_SERVER_HOST
env.label: Zabbix Server host
env.description: ZBX_SERVER_HOST - This variable is IP or DNS name of Zabbix server or Zabbix proxy.

env.name: ZBX_PASSIVESERVERS
env.label: Zabbix passive servers
env.description: The variable is comma separated list of allowed Zabbix server or proxy hosts for connections to Zabbix agent container. By default - docker bridge interface address.

title: Zabbix Proxy
name: zabbix-proxy
note: Choose right network (bridge preferred). This container port must be exposed for agents to connect to it.

env.name: ZBX_PROXYMODE
env.label: Zabbix Proxy mode
env.description: ZBX_PROXYMODE - The variable allows to switch Zabbix proxy mode. Bu default, value is 0 - active proxy. Allowed values are 0 - active proxy and 1 - passive proxy.

env.name: ZBX_HOSTNAME
env.label: Zabbix Proxy hostname
env.description: ZBX_HOSTNAME - This variable is unique, case sensitive hostname.

env.name: ZBX_SERVER_HOST
env.label: Zabbix Server host
env.description: ZBX_SERVER_HOST - This variable is IP or DNS name of Zabbix server or Zabbix proxy.

env.name: ZBX_SERVER_PORT
env.label: Zabbix Server port
env.description: ZBX_SERVER_PORT - This variable is port Zabbix server listening on.
